intro: Zeuxine odzalaensis, commonly known as the Congo buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a rhizomatous root system. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are borne on short pedicels. Zeuxine odzalaensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its tropical habitat.
